Articles.Content: Am I the only one who has an lv-909 with a max vacuum thrust of 14? Is this something new with 1.0.2 or have I failed to notice it all along?
Uh.... last I looked it had a max vacuum thrust of _60_, which is a slight buff (over 50 before). You might be looking at the sea level thrust?
Yeah the 909's my early career workhorse once in space.
I have occasionally (in older versions) hit a strange bug where my engines don't recognize they are in vacuum, so they get stuck on the sea level stats. Maybe you are seeing something like that?
Im sure it's vacuum I even checked the config! Maybe nuFAR has something to do with it.
Then it's a bug. 14 Thrust is 100% kerbin atmosphere.
Im sure it's vacuum I even checked the config! Maybe nuFAR has something to do with it.

In my VAB, I have 14.783 for sea level thrust and 60 for vacuum thrust. Must be some mod you installed that is doing this to you. It can't be a coincidence that your vacuum thrust is EXACTLY the same as what is supposed to be the sea level thrust.

Edited May 3, 2015 by mikegarrison
remember they just flipped the way thrust is determined, its probably a mod that was doing it the old way
Looks like you upgraded to 1.0.2 but kept the 1.0 files. Nuke your GameData/Squad folder and grab it fresh from a 1.0.2 archive.

Looks like you upgraded to 1.0.2 but kept the 1.0 files. Nuke your GameData/Squad folder and grab it fresh from a 1.0.2 archive.

Thanks this fixed the problem.
